news.title: Greater Bengaluru authority auctions seven properties in crackdown on ₹437 crore tax dues
news.para: Greater Bengaluru Authority (GBA) has initiated a crackdown on property tax defaulters, auctioning seven properties to recover long-pending dues. With ₹437 crore in arrears across nearly 7,000 units, authorities are using public auctions as a last resort. This move aims to recover unpaid taxes and ensure compliance from all property owners.

news.title: Over 1,400 illegal properties to be demolished in anti-encroachment drive in Rajkot
news.para: Rajkot Municipal Corporation has launched a massive anti-encroachment drive, demolishing 1,489 illegal properties along the Aji River and a municipal road in Jangleshwar. The operation, ordered by Deputy Chief Minister Harsh Sanghavi, involves over 1,200 officials and police personnel. Residents, some living in the area for decades, expressed anguish and uncertainty about their future, fearing homelessness.

news.title: BPTP to jointly develop 11-acre residential project in Surajkund, Faridabad
news.para: BPTP's subsidiary Urban Realtech is developing a large residential group housing project in Surajkund, Faridabad. The project will be built on an 11-acre land parcel. It is expected to have a developable area exceeding two million square feet. This venture aims to boost BPTP's regional portfolio and stakeholder value.

news.title: Banks can’t claim rights over flats booked to allottees: Rajasthan RERA
news.para: Rajasthan RERA has ruled that banks cannot claim rights over flats booked by allottees before a loan was created. The authority also stated that RERA proceedings can continue against builder directors and landowners even during insolvency. This order protects homebuyers in the Avalon Royal Park housing project, where a builder mortgaged the project after selling over 700 flats.

news.title: No misleading pre-launch advertisements, Telangana RERA warns developers
news.para: TG-RERA has warned developers and agents against misleading homebuyers with pre-launch advertisements lacking mandatory registration numbers. Projects requiring RERA registration are those exceeding 500 sq m or with more than eight units. Several entities, including Godrej Properties, received show-cause notices for non-compliance, with some ads failing to display registration numbers or adhering to guidelines.

news.title: NGT cracks whip on erring stone crushers to shield Shivalik Hills in Ropar
news.para: The National Green Tribunal has ordered the Punjab Pollution Control Board to strictly enforce environmental norms for stone crushers in Ropar district. Thirteen units found violating regulations and engaging in illegal mining have faced closure, environmental compensation, and criminal complaints. The board must now inspect remaining units and verify raw material sources within three months.

news.title: Karnataka RERA puts builders on notice over project updates
news.para: Karnataka RERA has initiated action against 155 promoters for failing to submit mandatory quarterly project reports. This move aims to enhance homebuyer rights and ensure builder accountability. Promoters face penalties for non-compliance, with a deadline set for March 31 to submit pending updates without charges.

news.title: Bengaluru's five civic bodies collects only 57.96% of their property tax target for 2025-26
news.para: Bengaluru's five new city corporations are struggling, collecting just 57.96% of their property tax target with the March deadline approaching. The South corporation leads at 60.65%, while North lags significantly at 52.48%.  Overall collections are down from last year, with administrative changes cited as a factor.  Achieving the full target now seems improbable.

news.title: Kerala: Landslide survivors pick new houses in township via draw of lots
news.para: Survivors of the Mundakkai-Chooralmala landslide disaster have selected new homes. A draw was held for 178 families who lost their houses. Beneficiaries chose houses in a township project at Kalpetta. Title deeds were handed over. Many survivors expressed relief after living in rented accommodation for 18 months. The chief minister will formally hand over keys on February 25.

news.title: Commercial plots for New Nagpur project-affected farmers: Maharashtra revenue minister
news.para: Maharashtra's revenue minister announced a historic package for New Nagpur, offering commercial plots to landowners affected by land acquisition. This initiative aims to boost support and accelerate city expansion. A statewide revenue campaign is also underway to deliver key services. The government is compiling lists for a potential farm loan waiver, focusing on needy farmers.

news.title: Vadodara civic body has no record of properties it rented out before 1983
news.para: The Vadodara Municipal Corporation is facing significant challenges in recovering approximately Rs 12 crore in outstanding rent from its rented properties due to missing old documents. Many rental agreements date back decades, with records for properties rented out before 1983 being unavailable, hindering rent collection efforts.

news.title: Activists to protest against illegal buildings at Belapur Hills in Navi Mumbai on Feb 22
news.para: Environmental groups are demanding immediate enforcement of no-development norms on landslide-prone Belapur Hills, citing concerns over encroachers and administrative apathy. Activists will hold a human chain protest on February 22 against environmental degradation and the lack of action despite directives from the State Human Rights Commission.

news.title: Goa's town planning department told to enforce STPs for all complexes with 24 flats
news.para: The Goa State Pollution Control Board has urged the town and country planning department to enforce its decision requiring residential complexes with 24 or more flats to install sewage treatment plants. The board also stressed that builders must maintain STPs for three years or until handover to housing societies, citing issues with non-functional plants and builder negligence.

news.title: Uttar Pradesh to utilise vacant society space under its redevelopment policy
news.para: Apartment owners in Lucknow and other UP cities can now redevelop housing societies, unlocking prime urban space.  A new state policy allows for bigger, better apartments if two-thirds of owners agree on layouts over 1,500 sqmt.  Developers gain incentives like development charge rebates and extra FAR, making redevelopment attractive.

news.title: Over 900 builders under Jharkhand RERA lens for not filing quarterly reports
news.para: In an assertive move towards improving transparency in the real estate sector, Jharkhand's real estate authority is holding 904 builders accountable for their failure to provide mandatory quarterly progress reports. A staggering number of registered projects—over fifty percent—have neglected to submit essential updates on construction and financial aspects, prompting JRERA to issue stern notices.

news.title: Mumbai: Shah Housecon's directors booked for cheating builder of ₹5 crore in SRA project
news.para: Police have booked two directors of Shah Housecon Private Limited for allegedly defrauding a developer of Rs 5 crore. The developer invested in a Slum Rehabilitation Authority project in Malad. He was promised permissions and tenant relocation. However, the accused failed to secure these. The developer later found the plot ownership was with a charitable trust.

news.title: Centre allots permanent homes; three JJ clusters near PM's residence told to vacate by March 6
news.para: Residents of BR Camp, Masjid Camp, and DID Camp near Race Course Road must move to new homes. The government has allotted 717 flats in Savda Ghevra. This follows a rehabilitation plan and a Delhi High Court order. Residents have until March 6 to vacate their current homes. Failure to comply will result in eviction.

news.title: Former Jaypee Infratech's managing director surrenders in Delhi's Tihar Jail
news.para: Former Jaypee Infratech MD Manoj Gaur has surrendered to Tihar Jail authorities. This follows a Delhi court's rejection of his regular bail plea. The case involves alleged fraud and money laundering linked to homebuyers. Gaur was arrested by the ED in November 2025. Funds collected for projects were reportedly diverted. Thousands of homebuyers were defrauded. Their projects remain incomplete.
